text:
Hi all,
We know that HubSpot can personalise the contents of smart modules using information about the contact - like lifecycle stage or list membership. 
But can we look at these contact details and control what information is pulled from hubdb and shown on a dynamic page?
Think of a directory page but it loads differently based on the contact viewing it.
Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m sure <@U22PU4G4A> can confirm but I believe that the smart content /contact related data loads before HubDB
And if I’m wrong then it should be possible by adjusting the Params based on the smart content triggers
You can make a smart module. Then you can change the parameters of the for loop that you are calling from one to another.
I third that remark in an affirming way, :wink: You can most certainly make a compound or contextual menu using hubdb and query strings in the url/api call.
I fourth that remark also in an affirming way - it’s possible
What <@U38EZFVFE> said ^ You can have a column in the HubDB table and request only rows with a certain value in that column based on the contact data
Super! Thanks guys! So, are any of you interested in working on this project? :slightly_smiling_face:

I am going to take the original question one step further too. How about HubDB as a relational database supporting that Amazon like experience of exposing related products based on the filtered results?
<@U7C3N3UV9> I have built a relational db out of multiple hubdb instances BUT it isnt made for that. it can be a little messy .
Yeah they worked well. You would need to understand how it all worked to maintain it but for what we needed it for it worked.
